content.raw:
I thought Gazebo 1.8.0 was being held until after qualification.

Is there a recommended version to use for qualifcation.  We have controller code that only works with the newer versions since drcsim debian release.
content.html:
I thought Gazebo 1.8.0 was being held until after qualification.

Is there a recommended version to use for qualifcation. We have controller code that only works with the newer versions since drcsim debian release.

content.raw:
Hi David,

What steps did you take to get these errors?

I just tested with these revisions on my system:
~~~
Setting up gazebo-nightly (1.7.3~hg20130509r096ec69b95be-1~precise) ...
Setting up osrf-common-nightly (1.0.6~hg20130509r0ca0ece5b122-1~precise) ...
Setting up sandia-hand-nightly (5.1.13~hg20130509rd0e4c0173a28-1~precise) ...
Setting up drcsim-nightly (2.5.2~hg20130509r844cd73465a0-1~precise) ...
~~~

and was able to start vrc p3 without errors:
~~~
roslaunch atlas_utils vrc_task_3.launch 
~~~

Also, the default gazebo release should still be 1.7.x:
~~~
sudo apt-get install drcsim
...
Setting up gazebo (1.7.3-1~precise) ...
Setting up osrf-common (1.0.6-1~precise) ...
Setting up sandia-hand (5.1.13-1~precise) ...
Setting up drcsim (2.5.2-1~precise) ...
~~~

Gazebo 1.8.x will not be released into the official gazebo release until after qualifications, but will continue to be available through nightly releases.

I've repeated on 2 machines

content.raw:
gazebo-nightly is Gazebo 1.8.x.  If you want Gazebo 1.7.x you have to install the non-nightly version of gazebo:

~~~
sudo apt-get install gazebo
~~~
content.html:
gazebo-nightly is Gazebo 1.8.x. If you want Gazebo 1.7.x you have to install the non-nightly version of gazebo:

sudo apt-get install gazebo

content.raw:
In the past, it seemed that all of the nightly builds worked together.

If I install drcsim-nightly, it is dependent on gazebo-nightly, even though apparently inconsistent.

If I try to install gazebo, it want to remove both gazebo-nightly and drcsim-nightly.

If I try to install drcsim-nightly (sudo apt-get install) after gazebo, it gives me

```
#!c++
The following extra packages will be installed:
  gazebo-nightly
The following packages will be REMOVED:
  gazebo
The following NEW packages will be installed:
  drcsim-nightly gazebo-nightly
0 upgraded, 2 newly installed, 1 to remove and 0 not upgraded.

```

I'll try downloading an older version of gazebo-nightly and see if that will work

If I try to install drcsim-nightly (sudo apt-get install) after gazebo, it gives me

  gazebo-nightly
The following packages will be REMOVED:

The following NEW packages will be installed:

0 upgraded, 2 newly installed, 1 to remove and 0 not upgraded.

I'll try downloading an older version of gazebo-nightly and see if that will work

content.raw:
http://gazebosim.org/assets/distributions/gazebo-nightly_1.7.3~hg20130509r096ec69b95be-1~precise_amd64.deb

Installing this version gives the same 1.8.0 error

1.7.2 from 8-May gave same error.
1.7.1 from 7-May had dependency issue.

content.raw:
I'm unable to reproduce the problem (`Failed to load plugin libgazebo_ros_api_plugin.so`) using the nightly releases.

I'm running the following versions, which are the latest available:

~~~
$ dpkg -l | grep nightly
ii  drcsim-nightly                              2.5.2~hg20130509r844cd73465a0-1~precise   Darpa Robotics Challenge (DRC) simulator
ii  gazebo-nightly                              1.7.3~hg20130509r096ec69b95be-1~precise   3D dynamics simulator for robotics
ii  osrf-common-nightly                         1.0.6~hg20130509r0ca0ece5b122-1~precise   Software and messages used in multiple OSRF projects
ii  sandia-hand-nightly                         5.1.13~hg20130509rd0e4c0173a28-1~precise  Software, firmware, and simulation models for the Sandia Hand
~~~

With those versions installed, I do the usual `source /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh` and then am able to launch various qual and vrc_task worlds, without a problem.

You've identified an inconsistency between the version reported by the Gazebo and the version embedded in the nightly debian package.  We ought to correct that, but it shouldn't actually cause you any problems.

To be clear, if you're going to use any of the -nightly packages, you need to use all of them.  The dependencies are set up that way, as are the conflicts, which ensure that you can't have, say, `drcsim` and `drcsim-nightly`, installed at the same time.

Perhaps you got into an inconsistent state by updating just one of the -nightly packages.  E.g., if you already have all the -nightly packages installed, and you `sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install drcsim-nightly`, you won't necessarily get a new version of `gazebo-nightly`, which might be needed.  That's an easy trap to fall into; I've created a [ticket](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/issue/16/make-version-requirement-on-nightly-debs) to fix it.

In the meantime, to ensure a consistent set of debs, I recommend explicitly uninstalling the -nightly packages before upgrading any of them:

    sudo apt-get remove drcsim-nightly gazebo-nightly osrf-common-nightly sandia-hand-nightly
    sudo apt-get update
    sudo apt-get install -y drcsim-nightly
content.html:
I'm unable to reproduce the problem (Failed to load plugin libgazebo_ros_api_plugin.so) using the nightly releases.

I'm running the following versions, which are the latest available:

$ dpkg -l | grep nightly
ii  drcsim-nightly                              2.5.2~hg20130509r844cd73465a0-1~precise   Darpa Robotics Challenge (DRC) simulator
ii  gazebo-nightly                              1.7.3~hg20130509r096ec69b95be-1~precise   3D dynamics simulator for robotics
ii  osrf-common-nightly                         1.0.6~hg20130509r0ca0ece5b122-1~precise   Software and messages used in multiple OSRF projects
ii  sandia-hand-nightly                         5.1.13~hg20130509rd0e4c0173a28-1~precise  Software, firmware, and simulation models for the Sandia Hand

With those versions installed, I do the usual source /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh and then am able to launch various qual and vrc_task worlds, without a problem.

You've identified an inconsistency between the version reported by the Gazebo and the version embedded in the nightly debian package. We ought to correct that, but it shouldn't actually cause you any problems.

To be clear, if you're going to use any of the -nightly packages, you need to use all of them. The dependencies are set up that way, as are the conflicts, which ensure that you can't have, say, drcsim and drcsim-nightly, installed at the same time.

Perhaps you got into an inconsistent state by updating just one of the -nightly packages. E.g., if you already have all the -nightly packages installed, and you sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install drcsim-nightly, you won't necessarily get a new version of gazebo-nightly, which might be needed. That's an easy trap to fall into; I've created a ticket to fix it.

In the meantime, to ensure a consistent set of debs, I recommend explicitly uninstalling the -nightly packages before upgrading any of them:

sudo apt-get remove drcsim-nightly gazebo-nightly osrf-common-nightly sandia-hand-nightly
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y drcsim-nightly

content.raw:
A combination of improper environment on my part and incorrect message  (1.8.0) on your part that led me astray.

Cleaning, updating, and setting environment seems happy now
